content.description:
In my opinion, this is both the the funnest and easiest route on the boulder.  Too bad the climb isn't longer! There is more than one way to start.  The easiest variation is to chimney up between La Cueva (boulder next to Sport Boulder) and Sport Boulder before swinging to the ledge and then climbing the face to the top.  You can also climb the left most face directly and without touching La Cueva boulder.   This goes at 5.9, at least if you are tall.

There are three bolts to a top anchor.

The route stays shaded for much of the day.
content.protection: 3 quickdraws and a two bolt anchor on top.
content.location: There are now four routes on the Sport Boulder. This climb is the leftmost (easternmost) route.

content.description:
Climb the second route from the left with four quickdraws to a top anchor.

The route stays shaded for much of the day.

Getting off the ground is the hardest part (5.7-5.8).  After that the climb is easier (5.5-5.6)
content.protection: 2 quickdraws and a two bolt anchor on top.
content.location: There are now four routes on the Sport Boulder. All are about the same level of difficulty (5.5-5.8). This route is the 2nd route from the left (east).

content.description:
Climb face past 4 bolts to a single bolt anchor with webbing.

A high foot to climb over the lip at the end is the most challenging part.
content.protection: 4 QDs and a single bolt to rap.
content.location:
This is behind

Fingers

on a large, detached boulder.

content.description:
Climb the 3rd route from the left on a face with three quickdraws to a top anchor.  Depending on the exact line chosen, this goes at around 5.8.

If you want a harder variation (5.9), Start and stay far enough away from the arete to not be tempted to use it. There is an arete variation on top rope that goes around 5.7. For this straddle the arete till you can get your feet on the small ledge and transfer onto the face to the anchors.

The route stays shaded for much of the day.
content.protection: 3 quickdraws and a two bolt anchor on top.
content.location: There are now four routes on the Sport Boulder. All are about the same level of difficulty (5.5-5.8). This climb is the leftmost (easternmost) route.
